name: MCCompiled
description: production-ready programming language that compiles to minecraft bedrock commands.

sections.WHAT: MCCompiled is a programming language that, rather than compile to instructions or any sort of IL, compiles to Minecraft: Bedrock Edition function files. Function files are collections of commands that are run sequentially, presenting a unique challenge as a compile target.
sections.WHY: I work part time as an addons/commands developer for Lifeboat Network's marketplace team. Developing large, sustainable projects with complex logic just wasn't possible, so I began this project on the side to help speed up my work. I open sourced it and released it to the Bedrock community. The demand isn't there, but that's fine.
sections.PARADIGM: Generally, MCCompiled operates as any traditional procedural programming language, similarly to C. Minecraft doesn't inherently have scope or even blocks, so code flow is boiled down to a little more than jumping in and out of subroutines. This was a challenge which was overcome well, but some adjustments need to be learned for one to actually write in MCCompiled effectively; specifically good knowledge about Minecraft's command system.
sections.IDE: MCCompiled also now has an IDE based entirely in a web-app, supporting easy file i/o, live code linting, symbol information, and compilation straight into development folders. It works using protocol URLs and a local http server to process the code. There's also good developer documentation with the support for other devs to develop software on top of this HTTP server.
